text.section: Before a physician operates on a patient to insert a breast implant, the physician shall inform the patient of the advantages, disadvantages, and risks associated with a breast implantation.

The Department shall:
Provide a standardized written summary in layman's language that:
Contains all the information on breast implantation generally contained in the information sheet for the breast implant; and
Discloses side effects, warnings, and cautions for a breast implantation operation;
Update as necessary the standardized written summary; and
Distribute the standardized written summary to each hospital, clinic, and physician's office and any other facility that performs breast implantations.

A physician satisfies the requirements of subsection (a) of this section if:
The physician provides the breast implantation patient with the standardized written summary described in subsection (b) of this section;
The patient receives the standardized written summary 5 days before the breast implantation operation; and
The patient signs a statement provided by the Department acknowledging the receipt of the standardized written summary.
